title: (x) 2 unknown fonts used by "werkplaats typografie" - AG Schulbuch {Nina, Jan, Andrew}/similar to Lineto Mono/FF Magda
content:
hi everyone!

i was hoping that someone could help me out, i have this nice "werkplaats typografie" info booklet (play play play) and they use like 2 really nice looking fonts for text, could someone pleas id these two fonts for me?  
thnx for the time!!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202031843im_/http:/typophile.com/files/id_4748.jpg)
author: Evie

comments.content:
For the first one I think my money's on AG Schoolbook Two.  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ag-schoolbook-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202031843/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ag-schoolbook-bq/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ag-schoolbook-bq/")  
FF Schulbuch Nord is also very close.  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_schulbuch\_nord\_normal/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202031843/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_schulbuch_nord_normal/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_schulbuch\_nord\_normal/")

1  
AG Schulbuch (There are two versions, one with more geometric caps and the other with more evenly sized caps, this is the latter)

2  
I was going to say Editor from optimo.ch but I don't think that is quite right.

hey thnx everyone!!

guess im spending 79$ :p

also still looking for that second one...:D
hey dtapia, mmmm close but not quite it....annyone ?

I'd love to know what it is, too.  
The closest I could get is FF Magda Clean Mono, which at least has a similar "W", but it's not it (see the "r", "i" etc.).  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_magda\_clean\_mono\_ot\_re...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202031843/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_magda_clean_mono_ot_regular/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_magda\_clean\_mono\_ot\_regular/")

hey altaria...mmmyeah close..was thinking that it could maybe be "simple" by norm but thats not it either.

tuff one

Here’s another similar yet not identical face:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/46552](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202031843/http:/typophile.com/node/46552 "http://typophile.com/node/46552")

I was thinking the second one was Mono from [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202031843/http:/www.lineto.com/), but it's not.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202031843im_/http:/typophile.com/files/type_4112.png)

Very curious about it now. :)
Stephen, I think it is Mono. At least, I can't see any differences.
It is certainly based on (the same source as) Mono. Note that in the sample, the ‘i’ has an upper serif; ‘a’, ‘n’, ‘p’, ‘r’ etc. have spurs.
Oops. I thought that larger sample was the font in question. Carry on.
Ha. Yes, indeed. That was just me illustrating what it wasn't. :)

I'm beginning to wonder if this could be a custom job, or an unreleased font. Would that make sense in the context?  
In any case, it has Cornel Windlin written all over it. Mono is his, and he was also part of the team that made FF Magda Clean that I linked to above.
